original_definition: 'heat generator' means the part of a heater that generates the heat using one or more of the following processes:combustion of fossil fuels and/or biomass fuels;use of the Joule effect in electric resistance heating elements;capture of ambient heat from an air source, water source or ground source, and/or waste heat;
generated_definition: 'heat generator' means a device that produces heat by converting various forms of energy into thermal energy.

Article 2: is equipped with one or more heat generators;

Article 8: ‘standby power consumption’ (solstandby) means the rated electrical power consumption of a solar-only system when the pump and the heat generator are inactive, expressed in W;
‘standby power consumption’ (solstandby) means the rated electrical power consumption of asolar-only systemwhen the pump and theheat generator are inactive, expressed in W;
